thread.title: Norway oil fund excludes 4 Asian companies over palm oil
thread.title_full: Norway oil fund excludes 4 Asian companies over palm oil

title: Norway oil fund excludes 4 Asian companies over palm oil
text:
Mon, Aug 17, 2015, 11:51 PM AEST - Australia Markets closed Norway oil fund excludes 4 Asian companies over palm oil Norway oil fund excludes 4 Asian companies involved in Indonesian oil palm plantations Associated Press – 30 minutes ago Recommend 21,050.00 -450.00 
STOCKHOLM (AP) -- Norway's $870 billion sovereign wealth fund has excluded four Asian companies over environmental concerns linked to their palm oil activities in Indonesia. 
Acting on a recommendation from its ethical council, Norway's central bank on Monday said the fund would divest from South Korean steelmaker Posco, its subsidiary Daewoo International Corp. and Malaysian companies Genting Berhad and IJM Corporation Berhad. 
The council said the companies may be responsible for environmental damage linked to the conversion of tropical forests into oil palm plantations in Indonesia. 
The fund, fueled by profits from Norway's offshore oil and gas sector, held shares worth more than $200 million in Posco and Daewoo at the end of last year and smaller stakes in the Malaysian companies. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Related Headlines Inquiry into gender retirement income gap AAP
